title: Should LoL have a R18 Option, Separating the Young and Old
body:
You can make your own judgements as to why I've said this as I believe there are countless reasons to do so.
But for the most part I believe that mature gamers are less likely to troll, afk, or be unskilled. 
Not to mention that some of the language that's used is definitely R18

replies.body: Not all 18 year olds are mature js.

> [{quoted}](name=Nature,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=YAIzRoH4,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2014-12-17T09:47:56.439+0000)
>
> Not all 18 year olds are mature js.

This.

And not all children are immature.

Age does not equal maturity.

riddle me this then, Why do ilI have better teams after say... 10pm-6am
All the kiddies have gone to bed is why

You're pretty naive or have subpar intelligence, just saying.

Maybe it's coincidence, you'd need to do a study on this that isn't biased. I've in my experience found that kids rarely even talk %%%% and it's the early aged adults that tell others to "neck themselves" to show their true alpha male dominance.

Even if you did introduce an "R18" system (that's hilarious) some 12 year old child can just say he's over 18. Curiosity triggers kids to do something.
Im fairly confident to an extent that there wont be much difference in the amount of trolls, afks and unskilled players even if there was a said separation in age
you may be right. I just had a mega troll. I wish i could name him so people could dodge his weirdness
Should seperate young and old but not R18 more like MA15 or M not really anything bad enough to have it classed as R18

imo it owldnt change much
just reduce the number of verble abuse reports, god for nid someone tell u ur crap ( and yep thats reportable been muted for it)
kids want what they can't have. if they're not supposed to say they're 18, they will. also, who wants to play with 12vies?
Lets just say hypothetically that they wont say their 18+ and will stick to the rules. Would you want this or not?

Lets just say in reality they will say they're 18+ and not give a cr*p for the rules (which is what would happen with most under 18s), then this entire suggestion is pointless so it wouldn't matter what peoples opinions are anyway. Also age doesn't affect whether a person is going to troll or not, nor does it affect skill.

Nothing, But what's the point in doing so? Its not like they get any different content. And doing so would put them at a disadvantage. Mature gamers are better. No doubt in my mind about that. They would be up against more experienced players
YES BUT THEY THINK THAT THATS WHERE THEY SHOULD BE BECAUSE THEY SHOULD BE IN CHALLENGER AND NOT IN BRONZE so obvs they will say they are +18 *(soz capps)

Until you realise,

The amount of troll and afk won't reduce at all and there are actually more unskilled in the R18 community.

Just a guess though.

To be quite honest, I think this option would force maturity. If everyone was an expected "r18" and they acted like qq baby trolls. Then it would no only show everyone else what a little loser they are. but they would be banned even faster.
Also it would give the younger kids a place to play free from the pressure and expectations of us mature players
